Recipes.Title: Apple Rhubarb Crumble (V)
Ingredients: 6 tablespoons chilled unsalted butter, cut into pieces
1½ pound baking apples , peeled, cut into 1-inch pieces
12 ounces rhubarb, cut into ½-inch pieces
Steps: Whisk oats, all-purpose flour, whole wheat flour, brown sugar, cinnamon, and salt in a medium bowl. Using your fingertips, work in butter until no dry spots remain and mixture holds together when squeezed. Cover and chill while you prepare the filling.

Preheat oven to 350°. Butter a shallow 2-qt. baking dish. Toss apples, rhubarb, granulated sugar, lemon juice, and vanilla in a large bowl; transfer to baking dish. Scatter crumble over fruit, breaking up any large pieces.
Place dish on a foil-lined rimmed baking sheet and bake until crumble is golden brown, juices are bubbling, and apples are tender, 35–50 minutes.

Recipes.Title: Banana Chocolate Chip Muffin (V)
Ingredients: 14 g (3 tsp) vanilla extract or vanilla bean paste
280 g very ripe banana, diced (not mashed)
Steps: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Grease your muffin pan.
In a small bowl, whisk together the milk, sugar, oil, apple cider vinegar and vanilla.

In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Add the wet ingredients and mix until just combined. Add the chopped banana and mix to incorporate, then fold in the chopped chocolate.
Divide the batter evenly between the 6 muffin cups. Sprinkle the tops with extra chocolate
Bake the muffins for 20 to 22 minutes or until the tops spring back when lightly pressed.
Remove from the oven and allow to cool in the pan for 5-10 minutes then remove from the pan and allow to cool completely on a wire rack.

Recipes.Title: Brown Butter Miso Coffee Chocolate Chip Cookies (V)
Ingredients: 220 g light brown sugar (or 190 g of brown sugar + 30 g of coconut sugar)
Steps: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.

Brown the butter and set it aside. Once cooled, add in a large bowl along with brown sugar, and granulated sugar. Using a handheld mixer or stand mixer, cream the butter and sugar together just until combined (about 1-2 minutes). Add the coffee, miso paste and vanilla extract. Cream together once more to combine.
Add the all-purpose flour, baking soda, and salt to the bowl. Fold the ingredients together until evenly combined. Then, stir in the chocolate chips.
Cover the cookie dough with cling wrap and place in the refrigerator to chill for at least 30 minutes.
Scoop the cookie dough into balls and transfer to the baking sheet.

Bake cookies for 12 minutes on the middle rack in your oven. The center should  appear underbaked. Once you remove them from the oven, let the cookies rest for 5 minutes on the baking sheet. They will de-puff and firm up while cooling.

Recipes.Title: Butter Beans & Grilled artichoke hearts with Ricotta
Ingredients: 400g artichoke hearts, drained and sliced in half
1 jar (700g) of Queen Butter Beans, drained
A handful of fresh parsley, roughly chopped
The juice of 1 lemon, zest reserved for garnish
Steps: Add all of the ingredients for the dressing to a small bowl and mix well to combine. Toss in the butter beans and leave to marinate will you carry on with the next steps.
Heat the olive oil in a griddle pan over a high heat. Add the artichokes with a pinch of salt and cook for 3-4 minutes, turning half way-through, until griddle marks show.
Add the ricotta to a mixing bowl with the zest of 1 lemon and whip into creamy consistency.

To plate, spread the ricotta onto a large serving plate, top with the artichokes, scatter over the marinated beans and finish with a drizzle of the last bits of the dressing. Finish with some lemon zest and an extra drizzle of olive oil.

Recipes.Title: Cabbage Pie (V)
Ingredients: ½ package of phyllo dough, thawed
2 tbsp melted butter or vegan butter
Steps: Quarter the cabbage and remove the core. Thinly slice and place in a large bowl.

Remove the stem and dark green part of the leeks and slice in half vertically. Rinse to remove sand and thinly slice. Add to the large bowl with cabbage along with salt, coriander, garlic powder, smoked paprika, and mustard powder. Mix thoroughly with your hands until cabbage becomes tender, about 3 minutes. Allow to sit for at least 30 minutes.
Pulse the cashews in the food processor until finely crushed. Add to the bowl of cabbage and mix.
Preheat the oven to 375F/190C.

Generously grease a 9" pie dish with butter and layer 3 sheets of phyllo making sure there is around 2-3” of excess. Brush the sheets with butter and layer 3 more and repeat. Add the last 3 sheets of phyllo and brush with butter. Squeeze the cabbage mixture with your hand to ring out any excess liquid and add onto the phyllo sheets. Crimp in excess phyllo to form an outer crust. lightly coat the crust and cabbage filling with neutral oil and bake for around 1 hour or until crust and filling is lightly browned and cooked though.
Allow to cool slightly before slicing and serve with yogurt.

Recipes.Title: Caponata (V)
Steps: Fry the aubergine on a medium heat in enough oil to just cover. Once lightly golden remove and season with salt. Allow to drain on a paper towel.
Using some of the aubergine frying oil, sauté the onions and celery until soft.

Add tomato paste and white wine. Cook on a medium heat until the wine has reduced by half. Add capers, olives, fried eggplant, vinegar, chilli flake, black pepper, and sugar. Check before seasoning, it should be salty enough from the olives and capers.
Serve with bread and enjoy.

Recipes.Title: Carrot Muffins (V)
Steps: Preheat the oven to 360°F (180°C). Lightly grease a smaller rectangle baking pan and line with a strip of parchment paper.
In a large bowl, mix brown sugar, white sugar, vegetable oil, soy milk, apple cider vinegar, vanilla, and orange zest.

In a separate bowl mix flours, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, and salt. Sift the dry ingredients onto the wet ingredients and gently mix with a spatula until just combined, and there are no lumps of flour visible but don't overmix the batter.
Fold the grated carrots and chopped pecans into the batter. Distribute the batter evenly into the muffin tins and Bake for about 40-50 minutes.
Remove the baked cake from the oven and let rest in the baking pan for about 15-20 minutes, then transfer the cake onto a kitchen rack and let cool down completely.

Recipes.Title: Cinnamon Raisin Swirl Bread (V)
Steps: In a large mixing bowl, sprinkle the yeast over the barely warm milk and water and allow to sit about 5-10 minutes until activated. Mix in the sugar, salt, and melted butter. Add the raisins. Gradually add flour, mixing until the dough comes together. If the dough is too dry, add small amounts of water until it does. If the dough is too sticky, add flour until it becomes workable; however, do not add too much flour or the bread will become dense.

Turn out dough on a lightly floured surface and knead the dough for 7-10 minutes until elastic. Cover dough with plastic wrap or a kitchen towel and let rise until doubled in a warm place, about 1 hour.
Now, prepare the filling. In a small bowl, stir together the sugar and cinnamon until evenly mixed. Set aside.

Punch down the dough before turning out onto a lightly floured surface. Roll out into a 9 by 15-inch rectangle. Spread some soft vegan butter over the dough before sprinkling the cinnamon sugar over it.

Starting with the shortest end, roll up the dough until a log is formed, folding down the ends. Transfer the log, seam side down, into a 9 by 5-inch loaf pan. Press dough down so it reaches the corners evenly. Cover with a kitchen towel and let rise for another 40-60 minutes until doubled.

Preheat oven to 350°F. Bake for 40-50 minutes, or until bread is golden and sounds hollow when tapped. Remove from baking pan and allow to cool slightly before 
slicing and serving.

Recipes.Title: Easiest Focaccia Bread Recipe
Ingredients: 4 cups (512 g) all-purpose flour or bread flour
2 cups (455 g) lukewarm water, made by combining 1/2 cup boiling water with 1 1/2 cups cold water
flaky sea salt, such as Maldon
1 to 2 tsp whole rosemary leaves, optional
Steps: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, salt, and instant yeast. Add the water. Using a rubber spatula, mix until the liquid is absorbed and the ingredients form a sticky dough ball. Rub the surface of the dough lightly with olive oil. Cover the bowl with a damp tea towel, cloth bowl cover, or plastic wrap and place in the refrigerator immediately for at least 12 hours or for as long as three days.
Line two 8- or 9-inch pie plates or a 9×13-inch pan with parchment paper or grease with butter or coat with nonstick cooking spray.

Pour a tablespoon of oil into the center of each pan or 2 tablespoons of oil. Using two forks, deflate the dough by releasing it from the sides of the bowl and pulling it toward the center. Rotate the bowl in quarter turns as you deflate, turning the mass into a rough ball. Use the forks to split the dough into two equal pieces (or do not split if using the 9×13-inch pan). Place one piece into one of the prepared pans. Roll the dough ball in the oil to coat it all over, forming a rough ball. Repeat with the remaining piece. Let the dough balls rest for 3 to 4 hours depending on the temperature of your kitchen (Note: no need to cover for this room temperature rise).

Set a rack in the middle of the oven and preheat it to 425°F. If using the rosemary, sprinkle it over the dough. Pour a tablespoon of oil over each round of dough (or two tablespoons if using a 9×13-inch pan). Rub your hands lightly in the oil to coat, then, using all of your fingers, press straight down to create deep dimples. If necessary, gently stretch the dough as you dimple to allow the dough to fill the pan. Sprinkle with flaky sea salt all over.

Transfer the pans or pan to the oven and bake for 25 to 30 minutes, until the underside is golden and crisp. Remove the pans or pan from the oven and transfer the focaccia to a 
cooling rack. Let it cool for 10 minutes before cutting and serving.

Recipes.Title: Falafels (V)
Ingredients: 1 small green chile pepper, serrano or jalapeno pepper
Steps:
The night before, soak the dried chickpeas in water. Make sure the water
covers the chickpeas by 2-3 inches, as they'll triple in size.

Drain and rinse the chickpeas and add them to your food processor, along with the onion, parsley, cilantro, pepper, garlic, cumin, salt, cardamom and black pepper. Pulse the food processor several times until the mixture resembles the texture of coarse sand.

Transfer the falafel mixture to a bowl and add the chickpea flour and baking
soda. Stir together, then cover or add a lid and refrigerate the mixture for 30 minutes to one hour.

Use your hands, an ice cream scoop or falafel scoop to form the falafel
into balls or patties. If you find the mixture is too wet, you can add
another tablespoon of chickpea flour. If it's too dry and crumbly, you
can add a teaspoon or two of water or lemon juice.

Once the falafel are formed, you can cook them by your preferred method
mentioned above. To deep fry the falafel, add about 3 inches of oil to a pot on medium heat. Heat the oil to 350F. Cook the falafel in batches
(about 6-8 at a time) for 1-2 minutes or until golden.

Use a skimmer to check the color of the falafel and make sure they don't
over cook. Then remove them to a paper towel-lined plate. Serve the falafel immediately, while warm and crispy on the outside. They're delicious served with tahini sauce as well.

Recipes.Title: Fennel Shakshuka
Ingredients: 1 stalk lemongrass, bashed and finely chopped
Steps: In a large pan, heat olive oil, add the anchovy and break down slightly with a wooden spoon.

Add the rosemary, lemongrass and chili and saute for 1-2 minutes to infuse the flavours in the oil. Add the fennel and continue sauteing for about 3 minutes. Add the pernod and tilt towards the flame (or use a lighter if cooking on induction), continue cooking for 2 minutes after the fire has died down to soften the fennel. Add the tomatoes and capers, cooking for about 3 minutes longer to allow them to break down a little.
Lower the heat and break in the eggs, seasoning them with salt (the rest should be salty enough thanks to the anchovy).

Cook for about 5 minutes, use the spoon to assure no parts of white remain uncooked. You want cooked white and runny yolk (unless you want something else, but in that case you're on your own). Finish with chopped dill and a drizzle of olive oil.

Recipes.Title: Fennel Syrup French 75 (V)
Ingredients: 1-2 cups of finely chopped fennel stalks

Recipes.Title: Green Sauce Pasta (V)
Ingredients: 2 tbsp vegan or regular butter, separated
Zest and juice of one lemon
Steps: Bring a large pot of salted water to a rolling boil, and cook pasta according to package instructions.
In a large skillet, add 1 tbsp olive oil, 1 tbsp butter, thyme, shallot, garlic, mushrooms, green onions, and kale. Cook on low for 6-7 minutes, until soft.
Add spinach, pine nuts, zest and juice of one lemon, and salt to a blender or food processor. Blend until incorporated.
Add the cooked mixture to the blender and blend until smooth-ish. Drizzle in remaining olive oil, remaining butter, and 1/2 cup of pasta water. Blend until smooth and silky.
Once your pasta is cooked, saturate your pasta in sauce, and top with loads of black pepper, grated cashew, parmesan and/or chili oil.

Recipes.Title: Green Tahini (V)
Ingredients: ½ cup loosely packed fresh parsley
1 large clove garlic, peeled and smashed
Steps: Add all ingredients to a high-speed blender and blend until smooth, scraping down the sides as needed.

Recipes.Title: Matcha Lemon Cranberry Muffins (V)
Steps: Pre-heat oven to 400°F degrees.
In a large bowl, combine flour, baking powder, matcha, salt, and sugar. Set aside.
In a medium bowl, mix together milk, vanilla, egg, oil, lemon juice, and lemon zest.
Add wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and stir until combined but be careful not to over-stir. Over-stirring will result in tough, dense muffins.
Add muffins liners to muffin tins or spray tins with non-stick cooking spray.
Distribute the batter evenly into the muffin tins and bake for approximately 15-17 minutes or until fork comes out clean. Transfer to wire rack and let cool.

Recipes.Title: Mediterranean Roasted Artichoke (V)
Ingredients: Same 6 garlic cloves roasted earlier with the artichoke
Steps: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.

Cut off the stem of the artichokes. Peel off the tough outer layers by hand. When you reach the softer layers, use a serrated knife to cut off about ¾ inches from the top. Now, cut the artichoke in half length-wise. Using a spoon, remove the fuzzy choke on the inside. Once cleaned, brush their surface with ½ teaspoon lemon juice to prevent them from discoloring.

On a large baking sheet, place each artichoke half in a piece of lightly-oiled foil paper large enough to fold around. Nestle 1 garlic clove in the center of each artichoke half before sprinkling with salt and pepper. Drizzle generously olive oil and close the foil around the artichokes. Roast in the oven for 40 minutes.
Carefully open the foil pouches using tongs. Remove the roasted garlic from the center of artichoke, and close the foils back until ready to serve. Let garlic cool.
In a small food processor, add the roasted garlic with the remaining vinaigrette ingredients. Pulse until smooth.
Remove the artichokes from foil. Arrange on a serving platter, generously drizzle the roasted garlic-dill vinaigrette. Top with shallots, capers and crumbled feta cheese.

Recipes.Title: Oat and Buckwheat Chocolate Chip Cookies (V + GF)
Ingredients: 1 flax egg (1 Tbsp flaxseed powder + 3 Tbsp water)
Steps: Preheat oven to 350º and line two baking sheets with parchment paper.
Brown the butter. Once ready, immediately turn off the heat, pour all of the butter, including the browned bits into a heat proof bowl.
While the butter is still hot, add the granulated sugar, brown sugar and salt to it, and whisk together. Next add in the egg and whisk together, until the mixture is shiny.
Add the milk and the vanilla and whisk until smooth. Then, add in the buckwheat flour, oat flour, and baking soda and mix together until fully combined. Fold in the chocolate chips.
Scoop and roll dough into balls about 2 tablespoons in size and place about 11, evenly spaced apart on each baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven for 9-11 minutes, or until the cookies are puffed up. Let the cookies cool for at least 30 minutes and serve.

Recipes.Title: Preserved Ingredient Cannellini Bean Salad (V)
Ingredients: 6-7 jarred quartered and marinated artichoke hearts plus some of the oil
1 bunch of dill with stems, finely chopped
½ preserved lemon, finely chopped (about 1 tbsp)
1 cup pistachio slivers or desiccated coconut, grounded

Recipes.Title: Ranginak [Persian Date Walnut Dessert] (V)
Steps: Mix the sugar, cinnamon and cardamom in a small bowl and set aside.
In a frying pan, toast the walnuts on medium-high heat, stirring every so often until fragrant (5-8 minutes) and set aside.

In the same pan, switch heat to low and melt the butter. While the butter melts, stuff the dates with the walnuts and arrange at the base of a an 8 inch pie dish or cake pan and pack them in as much as you can.

Go back to the butter, turn the heat to medium-high and combine the flour with a rubber spatula. keep stirring, making sure to scrape the base so it doesn’t burn until it thickens up slightly. Take off the heat when it smells toasty and fragrant.

Pour the mixture on top of the dates. Let cool for about 5 mins before sprinkling the sugar-cinnamon mixture and carefully spreading with your hands. Sprinkle the ground pistachio on top and press down gently but firmly.
Allow it to cool and set in the fridge for at least an 4 hours before slicing.

Recipes.Title: Rhubarb & Cinnamon Red Lentil Curry (V)
Steps:
Heat the tablespoon of vegetable oil in a large saucepan over a medium-high heat. Pour in the chopped onions and garlic. Fry for about 2-3 minutes until the onions are nice and
soft.

Add the 200g of sliced rhubarb into the frying pan along with the 2 tablespoons of garam masala, 2 teaspoons of cinnamon, 2 teaspoons of caster sugar and 1/2 teaspoon of cayenne pepper. Cook for around a minute, stirring well to combine.

Tip in the 300g red lentils and 750ml of vegetable stock. Bring the pan to the boil, then turn down to a simmer, cover and cook
for around 13 – 15 minutes until the lentils are cooked and the stock has reduced to a thick sauce.
Remove the pan from the heat and season to taste. Then stir in the 150g spinach and 30g chopped coriander. Stir the spinach and coriander until they have wilted sufficiently.
Serve the curry immediately.

Recipes.Title: Slow Cooked Lentil Curry With Rhubarb (V)
Ingredients: 3 rhubarb stems, ends trimmed, cut into large chunks
6 green cardamoms, fresh deseeded pods, crushed
Steps: In a large slow cooker, add all the ingredients, except the cilantro and the coconut cream-water mixture
Set the slow cooker to high, cover and cook the lentils for 2 hours and 45 minutes, or until the lentils are tender and the rhubarb is soft.
Dissolve the coconut cream in water and set aside.
Finish the slow cooked lentil curry by adding cilantro and the coconut cream-water mixture.

Recipes.Title: Spinach Gnocchi (V)
Steps: Blend together the spinach, cannellini beans and their juice, lemon and salt and pepper until smooth.
Pan fry garlic and chilli and then add the gnocchi and sautée until golden.
Pour in the sauce and let it simmer for a couple of minutes before topping it with the cheese, lemon zest, chilli and olive oil.

Recipes.Title: “Ground Beef” Tofu (V + GF)
Steps: Preheat over to 400 degrees.
Whisk together all ingredients except tofu in a large bowl until incorporated. Add tofu and mash to desired texture. The smaller you mash the tofu, the faster it’ll get crispy, so keep that in mind.
Add tofu to a lined or greased baking sheet. Make sure you evenly spread your tofu out on the sheet pan. Put in oven for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown and crispy.
